snippet: The advance set the Houthis more firmly on a path toward military confrontation with troops loyal to the president.
abstract: Houthi rebel fighters seize crucial installations in Taiz, Yemen, including city's international airport; seizure is one of most provocative expansions yet in rebels' seven-month offensive, and has put their forces on path to confrontation with opposing troops loyal to Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi.

byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. David D. Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo, and Somini Sengupta from New York.

lead_paragraph: The advance set the Houthis more firmly on a path toward military confrontation with troops loyal to the president.

headline.main: Rebels Seize Key Parts of Yemen’s Third-Largest City, Taiz
headline.print_headline: Rebels Take Key Parts of Yemen’s Third-Largest City
